author: Samantha Sharf
title: The Best And Worst Places To Be Young - In Photos: The Best And Worst Countries To Be Young 2015 - Forbes
text:
The Best And Worst Countries To Be Young 2015
Youthonomics, a new Paris based think tank dedicated to elevating the young, recently released a ranking of 64 countries according to the potential for youth to prosper within their borders. They define youth as people ages 15 to 29.
The index is based on 59 criteria including: youth unemployment rates, quality and cost of education, housing affordability, public deficit, access to technology, political and religious freedom and average age of elected officials.
The index only includes countries for which all 59 data points could be collected. This means many of the smallest and poorest countries are not represented. Neither are countries like Syria or North Korea, which war and authoritarian regimes have made terrible places to live at any age.
Click here for the full story.
Photo: Krister Soerboe/Bloomberg
